intro: Aganope marginata, commonly known as the marginate aganope, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, elliptic leaves with a distinctive waxy margin. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, followed by small, round berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
